meta.title: Operational Calculus: A Meta-Framework for Distinguishing Existence from Survivability
meta.author: Zelenka_D_D

citations.cite_as: Zelenka, D.D. (2026). Operational Calculus: A Meta-Framework for Distinguishing Existence from Survivability in Mathematical Processes. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18437225

abstract: We introduce Operational Calculus, a meta-framework that sits above classical foundations to distinguish between mathematical existence and survivability. While classical mathematics establishes what objects exist, Operational Calculus characterizes which structures persist under truncation, projection, and irreversible limiting processes. We formalize operational coherence as a primitive concept, establish axioms governing information flow in directed systems, and prove a Fundamental Theorem characterizing which mathematical statements admit operational proofs without requiring reconstruction from collapsed data. This framework explains why certain major conjectures (BSD, Riemann Hypothesis, Navier-Stokes) resist classical proof techniques: they require reconstruction of high-dimensional information from collapsed representations, violating the irreversibility axiom. We demonstrate that Operational Calculus strictly contains classical mathematics while forbidding operationally ill-posed inverse operations.
core_thesis: Classical mathematics proves existence. Operational Calculus proves survivability.

positioning.relation_to_foundations: Meta-framework sitting ONE LAYER ABOVE classical foundations (ZFC, category theory, type theory)
positioning.what_it_adds: Filters which constructions survive process-dependent erosion
positioning.what_it_does_NOT_replace: Does not replace classical foundations; extends them with survivability criteria
positioning.scope: Any system admitting resolution reduction: filtrations, quotients, projections, limits (finite or infinite)

directed_system.definition: Collection {X_n} with truncation maps π_{n+1→n}: X_{n+1} → X_n satisfying transitivity and identity
examples: Field extension towers with restriction maps
Selmer groups Sel_{p^n}(E/Q) with quotient maps
Decimal approximations of π with digit truncation
Sobolev space hierarchy H^k(Ω) with restriction k→k-1

operational_coherence.definition: Structure exhibits coherence if invariant I stabilizes non-trivially: I(X_{n+1}) →^π I(X_n) as n→∞

threading_depth.definition: For thread ξ ∈ lim_{←n} X_n, minimal index n_0 where ξ_n nontrivial for all n ≥ n_0

examples.selmer_points: Rational point P has minimal n_0 where visible in Sel_{p^{n_0}}

coherence_dimension.definition: Number of independent infinite-depth threads that stabilize under truncation

operational_attractor.definition: Entity A approached via directed process {X_n} → A but never reached in finite time, cannot be reconstructed from any finite X_n without loss
operational_attractor.reality_condition: Has reality only through stability properties, not attainability

Axiom_1_Truncation.statement: Every admissible mathematical system admits resolution-reducing maps: truncations, projections, or quotients

Axiom_2_Irreversibility.statement: Truncation is not invertible without loss. If π: X → Y with dim(Y) < dim(X), then no map ρ: Y → X such that π ∘ ρ = id_Y while preserving all structure
Axiom_2_Irreversibility.interpretation: Information loss under collapse is permanent
Axiom_2_Irreversibility.signature: The constant +C in integration is the operational signature of differentiation irreversibility

Axiom_3_Coherence.statement: Only invariants stable under truncation are operationally meaningful. Invariants that collapse under truncation do not represent persistent structure

Axiom_4_Attractor.statement: Limits are approached, not attained, unless coherence is zero-dimensional. An entity reachable only through infinite process has reality only as attractor
Axiom_4_Attractor.interpretation: Distinguishes finite attainability from infinite approachability

fundamental_theorem.label: thm:fundamental
fundamental_theorem.statement: Let S be a mathematical statement concerning an object reachable only through irreversible limiting process. Then: S admits operational proof IFF S is formulated in terms of operational persistence, coherence, and monotonic control. Any formulation of S requiring reconstruction of structure from singular or collapsed state is operationally ill-posed and admits no proof within consistent operational mathematics.
proof_sketch: (⇒) If S has operational proof, cannot invoke reconstruction (Axiom 2), must use only stable invariants (Axiom 3), hence formulated via persistence/coherence
(⇐) If S formulated via persistence/coherence, no reconstruction needed, track coherence dimensions through directed system (Axiom 1), invariants are meaningful (Axiom 3), proof exists

corollary_conditional_proofs_maximal.statement: Conditional proof 'If coherence persists, then S holds' is a COMPLETE operational proof. The condition is not a gap but an axiomatic boundary imposed by irreversibility.
corollary_conditional_proofs_maximal.implication: Certain conditional proofs should be viewed as OPTIMAL, not incomplete

BSD.operational: Coherence dimension of Selmer tower equals coherence dimension encoded by L-function attractor at s=1
BSD.why_classical_fails: Map L(E,s) → ord_{s=1} L(E,s) collapses infinite-dimensional analytic data into single integer. Leading coefficient L*(E,1) and all higher Taylor data irretrievably lost. Violates Axiom 2.
operational_strategy: Show Selmer tower {Sel_{p^n}(E/Q)} has well-defined coherence dimension (independent Z_p-threads)
Show L-function encodes same coherence dimension via functional equation and Euler product
Prove equality via monotonic control without pointwise reconstruction
BSD.status: Conditional on Bloch-Kato, Perrin-Riou, IMC, Greenberg

Riemann_Hypothesis.classical: All nontrivial zeros of ζ(s) lie on Re(s) = 1/2
Riemann_Hypothesis.operational: Critical line is unique location where prime threading exhibits operational stability
Riemann_Hypothesis.why_classical_fails: Zeros are operational attractors approached through spectral analysis but cannot be reconstructed from prime data without loss (Axiom 2)
operational_strategy: Define coherence via spectral stability of renormalized prime-threading operator
Show self-adjointness forces σ = 1/2 as unique balance point
Use monotonicity of operational potential to establish deviations violate stability
Riemann_Hypothesis.status: Conditional on Intrinsic Operational Gradient Theorem (IOGT)

Navier_Stokes.classical: Do solutions remain smooth (C^∞) for all time given smooth initial data?
Navier_Stokes.operational: Does flow coherence persist under energy truncation?
Navier_Stokes.why_classical_fails: Energy is scalar collapse: u(x,t) → ||u(·,t)||_{L^2} loses all phase and vorticity information. Cannot reconstruct pointwise regularity from energy bounds alone (Axiom 2)
operational_strategy: Define coherence via angular entropy H_j(t) in dyadic shells
Show viscous dissipation dominates threading deficit growth by factor 2^{5j}
Prove angular entropy remains bounded globally, preventing blowup

canonical_example_FTC.title: The Constant +C as Information Loss Signature

information_flow.integration_preserves: f → F is many-to-one but structured (accumulation rule)
information_flow.differentiation_loses: F → f is many-to-one and unstructured (erases constant C)

why_reconstruction_impossible.irreversibility: Once collapsed, C cannot be reconstructed from f(x) alone (Axiom 2)

what_FTC_actually_says.part_1: If F(x) = ∫_a^x f(t)dt then F'(x) = f(x) [fixes constant via boundary condition F(a)=0, not general reconstruction]
what_FTC_actually_says.part_2: ∫_a^b f(x)dx = F(b) - F(a) [computes difference invariant under lost C, not recovering F]

canonical_example_FTC.plus_C_principle: Whenever mathematical operation collapses information (differentiation, limits, forming scalars), there exists lost information that cannot be reconstructed without additional data

connection_to_major_conjectures.RH_analog: Prime distribution → ζ zeros, lost phase relationships

applies_to.finite_systems_with_resolution: Yes (subgroup filtrations, quotient hierarchies, representation towers)

does_NOT_apply_to: One-shot counting problems with no underlying process
Static enumeration with no truncation structure

limits_are_attractors.statement: Certain limits cannot be computed pointwise, only approached attractor-wise
examples: π: No algorithm computes exactly, only approaches
Random matrix spectra: Eigenvalue distributions are attractors (Wigner semicircle law)
Critical exponents: Phase transition values are limiting, not pointwise computable

applications.proof_strategy_diagnosis: If proof requires reconstructing high-dimensional info from collapsed scalar/singular limit, it is operationally ill-posed (will fail)
applications.algorithm_optimization: Precision beyond coherence depth of measurement process is operationally meaningless
applications.machine_learning_overfitting: Overfitting = learning finite-depth threads that don't persist under truncation (generalization). Regularization (L1, L2, dropout) = coherence filtering
applications.physics_renormalization: Renormalization = identifying operationally coherent quantities stable under scale changes. Renormalizable theories have finite coherence dimension
applications.dimensionality_reduction: Preserve coherence dimension (persistent structure), not just variance. Operational PCA retains threads with τ(ξ) < τ_max
applications.control_theory_stability: Lyapunov stability = persistent thread surviving truncation (perturbations). Design controllers maximizing coherence dimension of stable manifold
applications.cryptography_security: Security = coherence dimension of key space under adversarial truncation. One-time pad has maximal coherence dimension
applications.computational_complexity: P vs NP: Verification is truncation, solving is reconstruction. If P≠NP, coherence collapses under verification

alignment_with_physics.principle: What matters is not where processes end, but what survives the journey

parallels.thermodynamics: Entropy increase is irreversible (Axiom 2), microstate info lost in macrostate measurement
parallels.quantum_mechanics: Measurement collapse is truncation (Axiom 1), phase information lost
parallels.renormalization: Scale-dependent invariants are coherence (Axiom 3), only renormalizable couplings survive resolution changes
parallels.dynamical_systems: Limit cycles and strange attractors are operational attractors (Axiom 4)

relation_to_classical_mathematics.contains: Operational Calculus strictly CONTAINS classical mathematics
relation_to_classical_mathematics.does_NOT_discard: Does not discard classical theorems, filters which proof strategies are admissible
relation_to_classical_mathematics.explains_resistance: Explains why major conjectures resist classical approaches: require reconstruction from collapse (violates Axiom 2)
relation_to_classical_mathematics.conditional_proofs_optimal: Conditional proofs based on coherence persistence are not incomplete—they are OPTIMAL given operational constraints

future_directions: Formalize coherence dimension categorically or homologically
Develop operational invariants for specific mathematical structures
Translate additional classical theorems into operational language
Explore connections to computational complexity and information theory
Apply to algebraic geometry, representation theory, differential topology
key_insight: Ask not 'what exists' but 'what survives'. Existence is classical. Survivability is operational.
